channel.title: Adnan Shaikh
channel.description: A diary of Adnan's trials and tribulations as he forays into the world of blogging

item.title: Why I'm blogging (and why you probably should too)
item.description: I've always found that teaching someone a particular concept always reinforced my learning, so I figured writing down technical posts would be a great resource to both whoever might enjoy reading my melodramatic writing and for myself, to serve as a reference in case I forget it later. It's a
item.dc:creator: Adnan Shaikh
item.content:encoded:
I've always found that teaching someone a particular concept always reinforced my learning, so I figured writing down technical posts would be a great resource to both whoever might enjoy reading my melodramatic writing and for myself, to serve as a reference in case I forget it later. It's a bit daunting though, writing about something you feel you haven't mastered, i.e. telling someone 'How you should do X'. See: impostor syndrome.
I'd like to think of this process as a documentation of my learning (filled with sweet sweet gifs)


Let the learning begin
